strHeadline: Data Visualizations Dashboard With React Library Recharts
strDescription: Present data as visualizations to aid consumption. The app enables users to dynamically modify the visualizations to change the scope and make comparisons.

arrArt.name: cover

arrBullets: Use JavaScript framework React and data visualization library Recharts to present a large dataset via a dashboard interface.
Enable users to filter the dataset to be able to inspect it from many different perspectives.
Use Vite build tool, Recharts data visualization library, write JavaScript, React, HTML and CSS to develop a web app that presents a large dataset to users via a dashboard interface.

Enable users to filter the dataset via a segment of the user interface. Input elements trigger execution of logic that dynamically changes the scope of the dataset presented via the dashboard of visualizations.
Use visual design techniques to make the data visualizations legible and easy to interpret and to make the user interface feel intuitive and provide efficacious interactions for users.

strDescription: Responsive, Web Audio API, visual design.

arrArt.name: cover
arrArt.altText: Screen capture image depicts user interface of audio mixer widget.

arrBullets: To increase interest in and awareness of a new class, I built a JavaScript application to accompany a long-form story. The app, embedded on the page, helps readers understand experientially how students mixed audio during a semester-long class.
I used vanilla JavaScript and the Web Audio API to create the application.
UO students recorded the instrument tracks, and I used them to create the mixing effect.
Users can play, pause, mute or stop all instruments at once, turn off any single one or mute multiple, adjust the volume of each and play any solo.
Users of mobile devices can access all features via a responsive UI.

strDescription: Responsive WordPress theme, accessible semantic markup.

arrArt.name: cover
arrArt.altText: Screen capture images depict user interface of Honoring Tribal Legacies Wordpress website.

arrBullets: Select PHP, jQuery, SASS SCSS, images and HTML—GitHub

Design, build and publish a website that facilitates access to common-core aligned curricula for K–12 teachers. With the resources, teachers can meet common core goals while exposing students to the cultures, histories and significance of the peoples who are considered native to the lands now called the United States of America.

The users of the site are likely teachers of elementary, primary and secondary school children. I made decisions regarding the format of the content, the navigation of the site and its overall architecture based on the desires, values, expectations and behaviors of that persona. I interviewed teachers and sought feedback during each stage of the process, especially during prototyping, to ensure that my perception was accurate. I officially published the website during May 2015. I continue to receive positive feedback from the National Parks Service folks with whom I worked about the impact of the website.

My role in the project was to build a website, and my charge was to make it as accessible to as many people as possible. I reviewed and understood the content and sketched extensively before setting out to build. The value of sketching, prototyping, research and deep forethought cannot be understated—I believe the process leading up to production is the one that determines the ultimate quality of a product.

I chose Wordpress as the content management system, because it is an open-source, stable, supported and widely-used tool that is perfect for the simple tasks the website performs. I integrated my custom theme with Wordpress using PHP and used jQuery, HTML and SASS SCSS to create the structure, style and behavior of it. Git paired with GitHub, SublimeText2, and Adobe Creative Suite are tools that I employ during production to manage code versioning and collaboration, compose code and create graphics and video.

strHeadline: University of Oregon College of Education Drupal Website
strDescription: Create online tools for students, create and manage content, users, collaborate with departments, programs.

arrArt.name: cover
arrArt.altText: Screen capture image depicts user interface of University of Oregon College of Education Drupal website.

arrBullets: University of Oregon College of Education
University of Oregon College of Education

Interacted with the Drupal installation to manage the users and content of the University of Oregon College of Education website at education.uoregon.edu. I created tools that allow applicants to apply to programs and students to add and drop majors. I collaborate with a half-dozen people who also manage content and whose jurisdictions are limited to the scopes of their departments and programs. I create and advocate for publishing content that is user-centered—the mobile experience should be in equity to the experience on a large display, and it should be accessible and semantically accurate.
